summary: Usually, the General Services Administration buys or leases the real estate that federal agencies use for offices, labs, etc. However, GSA delegates some of its leasing authority to agencies. GSA is supposed to ensure that those leases' rental values and rates are fair and reasonable. Our recommendations address several issues we found: GSA could better identify and correct errors that we found in its database...
title: Federal Real Property: GSA Needs to Strengthen Oversight of Its Delegated Leasing Program
